explains: n. 编年史，大事记；（报纸名称）记事报；记事，叙述
v. 把……载入编年史，按事件顺序记载；翔实记载

sentences.en: Newspapers like the San Francisco Chronicle were chronicling their own doom.
sentences.cn: 像《旧金山纪事报》这样的报纸也在见证自己的衰落。

sentences.en: Chronicle is an informative and entertaining tour into history, beautifully illustrated and full of unbelievable facts.
sentences.cn: 《编年史》史料丰富、有趣，图文并茂，充满了令人难以置信的事实。

sentences.en: From then on his sketches, which appeared under the pen name "Boz" in The Evening Chronicle, earned him a modest reputation.
sentences.cn: 从那时起，他以笔名“博兹”出现在《纪事晚报》上的速写作品里，这些小品文为他赢得了一定的声誉。
